titles.title: To abolish the franking privilege for the House of Representatives and to establish a spending allowance for postage for official mail of the House of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Abolishes the franking privilege with respect to the House of Representatives. Establishes a spending allowance for postage for official mail of the House to be used for purchasing stamps and other postage rather than to pay for franked mail.
